alert.note: Alert for Dunn; Pepin (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 11:13AM CDT until April 19 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota and Wisconsin... Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County. South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. Chippewa River at Eau Claire affecting Eau Claire County. Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin and Minnesota... Chippewa River at Durand affecting Pepin, Dunn and Buffalo Counties. Minnesota River At Morton affecting Renville and Redwood Counties. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt upstream snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chippewa River at Durand. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, Highway 10 on the north approach to the bridge across the Chippewa River may flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 AM CDT Wednesday, the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1000 AM CDT Wednesday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.3 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.4 feet on 04/14/1965. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
